title: Unsend a Message in Outlook: Easily Recall & Replace Email

steps.title: Click Sent Items in the left panel of Outlook.
steps.content: Click Sent Items in the left panel of Outlook. Selecting this folder displays all of your recent sent messages. It's not possible to recall Outlook messages on the web. This method will work on Outlook 365, Outlook 2019, 2016, 2013, and 2010. If you're using Outlook 2007, see this method instead. If the recipient has already opened the message, has an email filter that instantly moved your message to another folder, or it's been longer than 120 minutes since you sent the message, you won't be able to recall it.

steps.title: Click the message you want to recall.
steps.content: Click the message you want to recall. The message will expand in the reading panel.

steps.title: Click the Message tab.
steps.content: Click the Message tab. You'll see this at the top of Outlook.

steps.title: Click the Actions or ••• menu.
steps.content: Click the Actions or ••• menu. If you're using the Classic ribbon, you'll see an Actions button in the toolbar. On the Simplified ribbon, you'll see three horizontal dots instead.

steps.title: Click Recall This Message.
steps.content: Click Recall This Message . As long as your organization uses Exchange and the message is not protected by Azure Information Protection, you'll have the option to recall the message. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Choose what to do with the message.
steps.content: Choose what to do with the message. When you recall a message, you can choose to Delete unread copies of this message or Delete unread copies and replace with a new message . If you don't want to compose a replacement message, choose the first option. To write a new message that replaces the previous message, choose the latter option.

steps.title: Choose whether to receive a confirmation.
steps.content: Choose whether to receive a confirmation. If you want to know whether the message was successfully recalled from all recipients' mailboxes, check the box next to "Tell me if a recall succeeds or fails for each recipient."

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . If you're not sending a replacement message, this last action will recall the message from all mailboxes. If you do want to compose a message, compose your replacement message now and click Send .

steps.title: Click the Sent Items folder in Outlook.
steps.content: Click the Sent Items folder in Outlook. Whether you're using a current version of Outlook or an older version, you can check to see if a recall was successful in your outbox.

steps.title: Select the recalled message.
steps.content: Select the recalled message. It should be near the top of your Sent Items. If you choose the option to notify you if a message was successfully recalled, you'll see "Recall Success" in the subject line. If the message was not recalled successfully, you'll see "Recall Failure" in the subject line.

steps.title: Click the Tracking button.
steps.content: Click the Tracking button. It'll be at the top of the message. You can use this option whether you asked to be notified about recalled messages or not. If the message was successfully recalled, you'll see "Succeeded" in the recall column for each recipient. If the message couldn't be recalled, you'll see "Failed" instead.

steps.title: Click the File tab at the top of Outlook.
steps.content: Click the File tab at the top of Outlook. If you find yourself frequently recalling sent messages, you can create a rule that delays sending messages in case you change your mind.

steps.title: Click Manage Rules & Alerts.
steps.content: Click Manage Rules & Alerts . You'll see this option in the middle panel.

steps.title: Click New Rule.
steps.content: Click New Rule . A list of email rules will appear.

steps.title: Select "Apply rule on messages I send" and click Next.
steps.content: Select "Apply rule on messages I send" and click Next . Another set of options will appear.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . Now you'll see several sending rules.

steps.title: Check the box next to "defer delivery by a number of minutes."
steps.content: Check the box next to "defer delivery by a number of minutes." This option is at the bottom of the list.

steps.title: Choose the number of minutes to delay the message.
steps.content: Choose the number of minutes to delay the message. To do this, click the blue text link in "defer delivery by a number of minutes," enter the number of minutes to delay before sending, and then click OK . You can delay messages up to 120 minutes (two hours).

steps.title: Click Next and then Finish.
steps.content: Click Next and then Finish . Now that you've created this rule, you'll have extra time to return to your Sent Items folder and edit your message before it's ever sent to the recipient(s).

steps.title: Click Sent Items in the left panel.
steps.content: Click Sent Items in the left panel. This displays all of your recent sent email messages. You can only recall a message you've sent in the Outlook desktop application for Windows and macOS. It's not possible recall Outlook messages on the web. If the recipient has already opened the message, has an email filter that instantly moved your message to another folder, or it's been longer than 120 minutes since you sent the message, you won't be able to recall the it.

steps.title: Click the message you want to recall.
steps.content: Click the message you want to recall. The message will expand in the reading panel.

steps.title: Click the Message tab.
steps.content: Click the Message tab. You'll see this at the top of Outlook.

steps.title: Click Other Actions.
steps.content: Click Other Actions . This icon is in the Actions group in the toolbar at the top of Outlook.

steps.title: Click Recall This Message….
steps.content: Click Recall This Message… . A pop-up window with a few options will appear. This option will not be available if your organization does not use Exchange and/or the email is protected by Azure Information Protection.

steps.title: Choose what to do with the message.
steps.content: Choose what to do with the message. When you recall a message, you can choose to Delete unread copies of this message or Delete unread copies and replace with a new message . If you don't want to compose a replacement message, choose the first option. Once you select this option, the message will be recalled. To write a new message that replaces the previous message, choose the latter option. If you choose this option, type your replacement response and click Send .
